p: To model the relative performance of containment and eradication strategies under this framework, we assume a circular infestation of radius r (m), a buffer zone related to the effective dispersal distance, d (m), and seed bank longevity, s (years). Total ‘costs’ in net present values are the cost of searching for and removing individuals, c ($ m −2) multiplied by the area searched every year, A (m 2), with future costs converted to net present values via an appropriate discount rate, δ This assumes that the cost of searching and removing individuals remains the same independent of how many individuals are found.
